concept_data.title: policy for responding to climate change

summary: The "policy for responding to climate change," also referred to as "climate change policy," is a critical component of the EU's environmental policy framework. This policy encompasses a range of regulatory measures aimed at mitigating the impacts of climate change through emissions reduction, adaptation strategies, and sustainable development initiatives. It aligns with international commitments, such as the Paris Agreement, and is designed to promote resilience within EU member states. The policy framework facilitates cooperation among stakeholders and integrates climate considerations into various sectors, ensuring a comprehensive approach to addressing the multifaceted challenges posed by climate change.
